thread.section_title: Arsenal star Hector Bellerin will not return to training until Friday – Metro
thread.title: Arsenal star Hector Bellerin will not return to training until Friday
thread.title_full: Arsenal star Hector Bellerin will not return to training until Friday

author: Simon Rice
title: Arsenal star Hector Bellerin will not return to training until Friday
text:
Bellerin had to come off against Chelsea (Getty) Hector Bellerin will not return to full Arsenal training until Friday following the head injury he suffered against Chelsea, according to reports.
The Spanish defender provided a positive update on his progress yesterday, telling fans on Instagram that ‘I’m recovering well at home and will soon be back on the pitch to help the team fight back!’
Arsenal star criticises Arsene Wenger's team selection vs Chelsea However this weekend’s match against Hull might come too soon.
Bellerin is still awaiting the results of an MRI scan after suffering concussion in his collision with Marcos Alonso at Stamford Bridge on Saturday.
The results of that scan will have a bearing on his availability for Saturday, however if he does not return to training until Friday – as the Sun report – he may not be up to speed for the early kick-off at the Emirates.
Alonso clashed with Bellerin on his way to opening the scoring in Chelsea’s 3-1 win (Getty) More: Football David Luiz makes surprise trip to see Chelsea's £68m summer transfer target 
Euro giants want £60m for Arsenal target who's decided he's leaving 
Exposed: Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez laziness highlighted in Chelsea defeat 
Arsenal fixtures Hull City (H) – Sat 11 Feb
Bayern Munich – Champions League (A) – Wed 15 Feb
Sutton – FA Cup (A) – weekend of 17/18 Feb
Liverpool (A) – Sat 4 Mar
Bayern Munich – Champions League (H) – Tue 7 Mar
Leicester (H) – Sat 11 Mar
West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar
Arsenal’s following match is against Bayern Munich in the Champions League, by which time Bellerin should be certain to have recovered.
MORE: Arsenal transfer target Alexandre Lacazette to cost £60million this summer
